title: About Me
description:
I'm Sanchay, a T-shaped designer. I design products and find myself at the intersection of user-centered design, engineering, and user research. My expertise lies in user research. With my experience designing super-structures and substructures in construction, I found my passion for product design and development as a Business Analyst.

I'm pursuing my master's degree in Human-Computer Interaction at Iowa State University. Before starting my journey in HCI, I worked as a Business Analyst for Revature, an EdTech firm based in Reston. I spearheaded agile product development, requirements engineering, and stakeholder management. I also served as a product owner for Learning Management Systems (LMS). Throughout my journey, I have gained wisdom and insight from many companions I have worked with.

I am drawn to solving problems visually, offering radical yet simple solutions, triangulating user needs, and learning from my missteps. During the summer, I was motivated to learn graphic design principles (from CalArts), composition rules, and meaning-making. This motivated me to take art classes this fall semester to supplement my artistic thinking. I enjoy pencil sketching, digital art, and doodling, whatever comes to mind. I also travel solo frequently and hope to explore hidden gems across the United States.

title: Flask and Jinja
description: To showcase my work, I created this portfolio website in Python. This is also my first foray into coding. I created this website using Python's Flask framework. Jinja web templating is used for the front end, with CSS and some JavaScript. For data structures, I used Pandas dataframe. This project was enjoyable to work on. I will enhance the website's fluidity and add more projects iteratively. The templating features offered by Flask are quite extensive. I created the model-view-controller architecture and deployed the code via PythonAnywhere. OpenSeadragon API is used to handle image properties and functions. For code reference, check my GitHub.
